Human resources management and professional training
full_summary:
###Temporary Help Services - Southern Alberta

#### Procurement ID
EW479-212627/D

#### Description
Temporary Help Services - Southern Alberta

This procurement is a Request for Proposal (RFP) for temporary help services in the Southern Alberta region. The services will be required to support federal government departments and agencies in one or more geographical areas listed in the Statement of Work (Appendix A).

#### Requirements
* Category 1: Administrative Support
* Category 2: Professional and Administrative
* Category 3: Technical and Operational
* Category 4: Telecommunications and Engineering Services

These categories are further broken down into classifications that can be viewed online at [ont-sat-ths.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/procedures/services-eng.cfm](http://ont-sat-ths.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/procedures/services-eng.cfm).

#### Security Requirements
This requirement includes security requirements that must be met. For additional information, see Part 6 - Security, Financial and Insurance Requirements, and Part 7 - Standing Offer and Resulting Contract Clauses.

#### Mandatory Criteria
* Offerors must have a fully operational, permanent, commercial office in the Province for which they are submitting an offer.
* Offerors must provide a statement indicating the office, in the Province for which they are submitting an offer, will be open Monday to Friday for a minimum of 7.5 hours per day, excluding Statutory Holidays.
* Offerors must provide a statement indicating there are a minimum of 2 full-time employees working in the office of the Province for which they are submitting an offer.
* Offerors must describe the tools or procedures or instruments in place to test for the various skills and aptitudes for the type(s) of temporary help services category(ies) offered.
* Offerors must describe their current internal quality control process to evaluate overall service and the performance of the temporary help employees.

#### Preferred Criteria
* Offerors may provide information on preferred margins for Greening, Accessibility and Social Commitments.

#### Submission
* Suppliers are strongly encouraged to submit bids electronically using the Canada Post epost Connect application for the subject bid solicitation.
* Faxed bids will be accepted at 1-418-566-6167.
* Hard copy (submitted in person or via mail/courier) bids will not be accepted for the subject bid solicitation.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

#### Important Notice
